get.summary: Gets a list of basic supplier information

parameters.name: LastSupplierUpdate
parameters.description: The date to filter the suppliers by the latest modified date in medius, using ISO 8601 format yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ (2021-20-10T14:01:54.9571247Z)

requestBody.description: This request is used to create or update a new supplier including supplier contacts.

get.summary: Get details of a particular supplier

parameters.name: Code
parameters.description: The medius/Tenant identifier for the supplier (Supplier code)

get.description: Get all contracts filtered between the last modified date and the lastintegrated date. Also supports filtering on multiple contract statuses and types.

parameters.name: LastMediusUpdate
parameters.description: The date to filter the last modified contracts by (Integrated date), using ISO 8601 format yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ (2021-20-10T14:01:54.9571247Z)

parameters.name: ContractStatus
parameters.description: Filter the contracts by multiple contract statuses

parameters.name: ContractType
parameters.description: Filter the contracts by multiple contract types

put.description: Update the contract by passing in list of properties

Code.description: <Tenant> Id , Unique Id of the supplier.

SupplierModifiedDate.description: Date/Time the supplier was last modified.

Code.description: <Tenant> Id , Unique Id of the supplier.

SupplierApprovalStatus.description: Supplier approval status mapped in medius, values to use are "approved","New","rejected"

TaxRegistrationNumber.description: Tax registration number or supplier number

Username.description: Username for the supplier contact,if not provided the email address will be used

Email.description: Business email address for the contact

PartnerID.description: Medius code assigned to the trading relationship entity

PartnerName.description: Name of the trading partner in Medius

Created.description: Date the contract was initially created

SourcingEventName.description: If the contract was created from a sourcing event, the sourcing reference will be populated

NoticePeriodValue.description: Used with NoticePeriodUnit to state when the notice period is hit

NoticePeriodUnit.description: Used with NoticePeriodValue to state when the notice period is hit. Will be one of Days, Months, Years

AutoExtensionDurationType.description: Determines the type of auto extension. Will be one of NoExtension, AutoExtensionFull, AutoExtensionMonthly

AutoExtensionDurationInMonths.description: Used when AutoExtensionDurationType is set to AutoExtensionMonthly to determine how many months the duration will increase by when the contract auto extensions

ContractDurationInMonths.description: The duration of the contract from its Effective date to its End Date. If the contract is Evergreen then this will be the duration from the EffectiveDate to the current date

Suspended.description: Flag to indicate the contract has been set in to a suspended state by a user of the application

TerminationDate.description: The date on which the contract will become terminated. This is used when the contract needs to end prior to it's normal End Date

TerminationReference.description: Optional reference field for when a contract is being terminated

PendingTermination.description: A true/false flag indicating the contract has been set to terminate early, on the Termination Date

ContractStatus.description: Status of the contract, can be the following values InitialCreation,WaitingApproval,Approved,FailedApproval,Activated,FailedActivation,Effective,Expired,Terminated,Archived

LastMediusUpdate.description: Date/Time the contract was last updated in Medius

ContractNumber.description: Unique Id of the contract in medius.

Type.description: Error type identifier, cannonical reference for implemenors and recipients, providing detailed description of the error and corrective actions if possible

Status.description: HTTP status code returned with this error

Title.description: Human readable short description of the error, more details available from 'type' url
Title.example: API key is missing or invalid

Instance.description: Specific error instance identifier, useful for API implementors to investigate an error
